com.pump.image.pixel

Class GenericImageSinglePassIterator.NonSinglePassException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.pump.image.pixel.GenericImageSinglePassIterator.NonSinglePassException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Enclosing class:
    GenericImageSinglePassIterator

    public static class GenericImageSinglePassIterator.NonSinglePassException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException
    This exception indicates that the source image did not provide all the pixel data in a single pass. (That is: it might have provided row 1, 3, and then row 2. The GenericImageSinglePassIterator requires this data be delivered in consecutive rows.)

    If this occurs, I recommend trying the BmpEncoder class. This can write an image to a RandomAccessFile in multiple arbitrary passes as a BMP, and then the BmpDecoder can read the final image back in a PixelIterator.

    See Also:
